conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on each block and determine the frictional forces involved.
The four blocks are accelerating as a single unit due to the horizontal force F.
The accelerations of the blocks can be considered equal.
Denote the mass of each block as m and the common acceleration as a.
The total external force applied to the system is F.
Using Newton's second law, a = F / 4m.
Force on Block A is provided by the tension in the spring from Block B: T_A = F / 4.
Block B has an external force F and the force T_B exerted by the spring from Block C: T_B = 3F / 4.
Block C experiences the force from Block B and the reaction force T_C from the spring to Block D: T_C = F / 2.
Block D experiences the force exerted by the spring from Block C: T_D = F / 4.
Since the surface is smooth, there is no frictional force between Block D and the ground.
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D is 0.
